s0292.chinese: 是不布利而懼難乎，故能載周以至于今。
s0292.literal: Is this not distributing profit and fearing disaster? Therefore they could carry Zhou to the present day.
s0292.idiomatic: Is this not distributing profit and fearing disaster? Therefore they could carry Zhou to the present day.

s0293.literal: Now the king learns to monopolize profit, is this permissible?
s0293.idiomatic: Now the king learns to monopolize profit, is this permissible?

s0294.chinese: 匹夫專利，猶謂之盜，王而行之，其歸鮮矣。
s0294.literal: A common man monopolizes profit, and is still called a thief; if the king does it, his followers will be few.
s0294.idiomatic: A common man monopolizes profit, and is still called a thief; if the king does it, his followers will be few.

s0295.literal: If Rong Gong is employed, Zhou will certainly fail.'
s0295.idiomatic: If Rong Gong is employed, Zhou will certainly fail.'

s0296.chinese: 厲王不聽，卒以榮公為卿士，用事。
s0296.literal: King Li did not listen, and ultimately made Rong Gong the chief minister, who handled affairs.
s0296.idiomatic: King Li did not listen, and ultimately made Rong Gong the chief minister, who handled affairs.

s0297.chinese: 王行暴虐侈傲，國人謗王。
s0297.literal: The king acted tyrannically, extravagantly, and arrogantly; the people of the capital slandered the king.
s0297.idiomatic: The king acted tyrannically, extravagantly, and arrogantly; the people of the capital slandered the king.

s0298.literal: Shao Gong advised: 'The people cannot bear the commands anymore.'
s0298.idiomatic: Shao Gong advised: 'The people cannot bear the commands anymore.'

s0299.chinese: 王怒，得衛巫，使監謗者，以告則殺之。
s0299.literal: The king was angry, obtained a shaman from Wei, made him monitor those who slandered, and if reported, killed them.
s0299.idiomatic: The king was angry, obtained a shaman from Wei, made him monitor those who slandered, and if reported, killed them.

s0300.literal: Slander became rare, but the feudal lords did not come to court.
s0300.idiomatic: Slander became rare, but the feudal lords did not come to court.

s0301.chinese: 三十四年，王益嚴，國人莫敢言，道路以目。
s0301.literal: In the thirty-fourth year, the king became even more severe; the people of the capital dared not speak, they communicated with their eyes on the roads.
s0301.idiomatic: In the thirty-fourth year, the king became even more severe; the people of the capital dared not speak, they communicated with their eyes on the roads.

s0302.chinese: 厲王喜，告召公曰：「吾能弭謗矣，乃不敢言。」
s0302.literal: King Li was pleased, told Shao Gong: 'I have been able to stop slander; now they dare not speak.'
s0302.idiomatic: King Li was pleased, told Shao Gong: 'I have been able to stop slander; now they dare not speak.'

s0303.literal: Shao Gong said: 'This is damming it up.
s0303.idiomatic: Shao Gong said: 'This is damming it up.

s0304.literal: Blocking the people's mouths is worse than blocking water.
s0304.idiomatic: Blocking the people's mouths is worse than blocking water.

s0305.chinese: 水壅而潰，傷人必多，民亦如之。
s0305.literal: Water that is dammed up and bursts will injure many people; the people are the same.
s0305.idiomatic: Water that is dammed up and bursts will injure many people; the people are the same.

s0306.chinese: 是故為水者決之使導，為民者宣之使言。
s0306.literal: Therefore for water one opens it to guide it, for the people one opens them to make them speak.
s0306.idiomatic: Therefore for water one opens it to guide it, for the people one opens them to make them speak.

s0307.chinese: 故天子聽政，使公卿至於列士獻詩，瞽獻曲，史獻書，師箴，瞍賦，矇誦，百工諫，庶人傳語，近臣盡規，親戚補察，瞽史教誨，耆艾修之，而後王斟酌焉，是以事行而不悖。
s0307.literal: Therefore when the Son of Heaven hears government, he causes the nobles and ministers down to the ranked scholars to present poems, the blind musicians to present songs, the historians to present books, the masters to remonstrate, the blind to recite, the sighted blind to chant, the hundred craftsmen to remonstrate, the common people to transmit words, close ministers to give full advice, relatives to supplement and examine, blind officials and historians to teach and admonish, elders to correct it, and then the king considers it, which is why affairs proceed without error.
s0307.idiomatic: Therefore when the Son of Heaven hears government, he causes the nobles and ministers down to the ranked scholars to present poems, the blind musicians to present songs, the historians to present books, the masters to remonstrate, the blind to recite, the sighted blind to chant, the hundred craftsmen to remonstrate, the common people to transmit words, close ministers to give full advice, relatives to supplement and examine, blind officials and historians to teach and admonish, elders to correct it, and then the king considers it, which is why affairs proceed without error.

s0308.chinese: 民之有口也，猶土之有山川也，財用於是乎出：猶其有原隰衍沃也，衣食於是乎生。
s0308.literal: The people's having mouths is like the earth having mountains and rivers - wealth comes out from them; like having plains, marshes, plains, and fertile lands - clothing and food are born from them.
s0308.idiomatic: The people's having mouths is like the earth having mountains and rivers - wealth comes out from them; like having plains, marshes, plains, and fertile lands - clothing and food are born from them.

s0309.chinese: 口之宣言也，善敗於是乎興。
s0309.literal: The mouths' open declarations - good and bad arise from this.
s0309.idiomatic: The mouths' open declarations - good and bad arise from this.

s0310.chinese: 行善而備敗，所以產財用衣食者也。
s0310.literal: Practice good and prepare for failure, this is what produces wealth, implements, clothing, and food.
s0310.idiomatic: Practice good and prepare for failure, this is what produces wealth, implements, clothing, and food.

s0311.chinese: 夫民慮之於心而宣之於口，成而行之。
s0311.literal: Now the people consider it in their hearts and declare it with their mouths, complete it and carry it out.
s0311.idiomatic: Now the people consider it in their hearts and declare it with their mouths, complete it and carry it out.
